intro: Astripomoea hyoscyamoides var. melandrioides, commonly known as the sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. It has a sprawling growth habit and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species in its native range.
